channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [GROOVY-9978] ASM reporting processing error
item.description:
Starting with Groovy 3.0.6 I get the following error in my project. Need to check if I can build a simple recreation script. Might be related to GROOVY-9704

 

General error during instruction selection: ASM reporting processing error for com.dxc.eis.SSDConnector.SSDConnector$_processQueue_closure1#doCall with signature java.lang.Object doCall(java.lang.Object) in SSDConnector.groovy:184. /home/jogi/IdeaProjects/SSDConnector/src/main/groovy/com/dxc/eis/SSDConnector/SSDConnector.groovyGeneral error during instruction selection: ASM reporting processing error for com.dxc.eis.SSDConnector.SSDConnector$_processQueue_closure1#doCall with signature java.lang.Object doCall(java.lang.Object) in SSDConnector.groovy:184. status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Still trying to find a replication case ... but in my code it works if I replace

nrResendRequest++

with 

nrResendRequest = nrResendRequest + 1

This is very weird:

 

    private void processQueue() {
        if (processingStarted) {
            return
        }
        log.info("Starting processing of incoming events")
        processingStarted = true
        queueProcessingTask = task {
            int nrEventsProcessed = 0
            while (!stopProcessing) {
                SSDEvent curEvent = eventQueue.val as SSDEvent
                try {
                    if (sendEventToSSD(curEvent)) {
                        nrEventsProcessed++
                        log.debug("Processed ${nrEventsProcessed} events.")
                    } else {
                        if (nrResendRequest < nrResendRequestMax) {
                            nrResendRequest = nrResendRequest + 1
//                            nrResendRequest++
                        }
                        addEventToQueue(curEvent)
                    }
                } catch (RejectedExecutionException e) {
                    log.error("Event with size {} for {} agent dropped, hbcInterval: {}", curEvent.getJSONEvent().length(), curEvent.agent ?: 'undefined', curEvent.hbcTimeout)
                }
            }
            log.info("Stopping processing of incoming events")
        }
    }

The nrEventsProcessed can be updated via nrEventsProcessed++ but the nrResendRequest++ fails.

With this simplified code it happens as well:

private void processQueue() {
    queueProcessingTask = task {
        while (!stopProcessing) {
            nrResendRequest++
            // do something useful
        }
    }
}
Are you able to try with the Groovy 3 snapshot build? We have looked into some ++/-- issues late last year.
Where can I find that snapshot from within Gradle?

It is described here: https://groovy-lang.org/install.html#_snapshots

As for linking this into your Gradle build, you may need to google that or ask on the mailing list.

Tried current 3.0.8 snapshot (groovy-all-3.0.8-20210310.044807-84) and the error looks a little bit different now:

I can take a look if you can give a standalone recreation script. In your latest snippet, I don't know what nrResendRequest refers to.
you can extract it and run ./gradlew build .... SSDConnErr.tar.gz
The problem with pre and post increment/decrement under static compilation was fixed by GROOVY-9892. I was able to confirm using your sample project.
